channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Hard-Left Shooters Leading a Gun Culture Revolution
item.description: Earlier this year, I attended a shooting competition for queer, often trans, very online misfits. Then Charlie Kirk was killed.

item.title: The 5 Best Bread Makers for Homemade Loaves (2025)
item.description: From gluten-free to sourdough and beyond, swap store-bought bread for freshly baked with these convenient machines.

item.title: Momentic raises $15M to automate software testing
item.description: AI testing startup Momentic has raised $15 million in a Series A round led by Standard Capital, with participation from Dropbox Ventures. Existing inv...

item.title: A Research Leader Behind ChatGPT’s Mental Health Work Is Leaving OpenAI
item.description: The model policy team leads core parts of AI safety research, including how ChatGPT responds to users in crisis.

item.title: Facebook takes on Reddit with launch of nicknames for Facebook Groups
item.description: Facebook users can protect their privacy in Groups using a new nicknames feature.

item.title: Malaysia may ban users under 16 from social media starting next year
item.description: The country's communications minister Fahmi Fadzil said the administration is considering systems for implementing age restrictions on social media si...

item.title: Best Apple Watch (2025): Buyer’s Guide to the Series 11, SE 3, and Ultra 3
item.description: Should you splurge on the new Series 11? Or will the Watch SE 3 do? Let us help you figure out which version to get (and which to avoid).

item.title: Former MrBeast content strategist is building an AI tool for creator ideation and analytics
item.description: Palo is tool for short video creators to gain insights into what is working for them.

item.title: 21 Best Gifts for Coffee Lovers (2025): Drips, Pours, and Shots
item.description: Fantastic ideas for the coffee snobs, at-home baristas, and commercial-grade caffeine addicts in your life.

item.title: US banks scramble to assess data theft after hackers breach financial tech firm
item.description: U.S. banking giants including JPMorgan Chase, Citi, and Morgan Stanley are working to identify what data was stolen in a recent cyberattack on a New Y...
